title: Layered functional materials - beyond 'graphene'
objective:
There is an apparent lack of non-metallic 2D-matrials for the construction of electronic devices, as only five materials of the ìgraphene familyî are known: graphene, hBN, BCN, fluorographene, and graphene oxide ñ none of them with a narrow bandgap close to commercially used silicon. This ERC-StG proposal, BEGMAT, outlines a strategy for design, synthesis, and application of layered, functional materials that will go beyond this exclusive club. These materials ìbeyond grapheneî (BEG) will have to meet ñ like graphene ñ the following criteria: 
(1) The BEG-materials will feature a transfer of crystalline order from the molecular (pm-range) to the macroscopic level (cm-range), 
(2) individual, free-standing layers of BEG-materials can be addressed by mechanical or chemical exfoliation, and 
(3) assemblies of different BEG-materials will be stacked as van der Waals heterostructures with unique properties. 
In contrast to the existing ìgraphene familyî, 
(4) BEG-materials will be constructed in a controlled way by covalent organic chemistry in a bottom-up approach from abundant precursors free of metals and critical raw materials (CRMs). 
Moreover ñ and unlike ñ many covalent organic frameworks (COFs), 
(5) BEG-materials will be fully aromatic, donor-acceptor systems to ensure that electronic properties can be addressed on macroscopic scale. 
The potential to make 2D materials ìbeyond grapheneî is a great challenge to chemical bond formation and material design. In 2014 the applicant has demonstrated the feasibility of the concept to expand the ìgraphene familyî with triazine-based graphitic carbon, a compound highlighted as an ìemerging competitor for the miracle materialî graphene. Now, the PI has the opportunity to build a full-scale research program on layered functional materials that offers unique insights into controlled, covalent linking-chemistry, and that addresses practicalities in device manufacture, and structure-properties relationships.
